Description: Mould-made pottery lantern or lamp-holder with a cylindrical body and three stubby feet. The front is in the form of a slave mask with a floral fillet above the brow, above which is a cornice encircling the lantern, decorated at the front with impressed ovules. The rear of the body has a grooved moulding round the lower part, and a relief column between two cut-out petal-shaped holes. The conical top is decorated with four serrated ribs, palmette designs and punched holes. The knob or lug at the apex is mainly missing. Covered with a yellow to purple-brown slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q612)
